pyhpeimc.plat.perf module¶

pyhpeimc.plat.perf.add_perf_task(task, auth, url)[source]¶
function takes the a python dict containing all necessary fields for a performance tasks, transforms the dict into
JSON and issues a RESTFUL call to create the performance task.

device.

Parameters:
  • task – dictionary containing all required fields for performance tasks
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

204
Return type:

str

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.perf import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> new_task = {'indexDesc': '1.3.6.1.4.1.9.9.13.1.3.1.3','indexType': '[index1[0]:ciscoEnvMonTemperatureStatusValue:1:0]','itemFunction': '1.3.6.1.4.1.9.9.13.1.3.1.3','itemName': 'Cisco_Temperature','selectDefaultUnit': '400','unit': 'Celsius'}

>>> new_perf_task = add_perf_task(new_task, auth.creds, auth.url)
pyhpeimc.plat.perf.get_perf_task(task_name, auth, url)[source]¶

function takes the a str object containing the name of an existing performance tasks and issues a RESTFUL call to the IMC REST service. It will return a list

Parameters:
  • task_name – str containing the name of the performance task
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

204
Return type:

dict

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.perf import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> selected_task = get_perf_task('Cisco_Temperature', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> assert type(selected_task) is dict

>>> assert 'taskName' in selected_task
